stories.title: AI Algorithm Can Create Digital Copies of Real-World Objects

stories.text:
So I got an Android (Samsung A52S 5G, $200 deal) for the first time ever since growing up on iPhone (I think I was 15 and got a 3GS, time flies!) a couple of months ago. I do Software development / Web Development for work, so you'd think I'd be a harder target to be messed with... But here I am rotating passwords, knowing damn well theres too much data to change to feel certain nothing has been leaked.

Long before, when I first played around with my Android, I've noticed the Twitch.tv app played in the background just fine. Nothing unusual right? Thing is, it also did that whenever I closed the app through the app switcher.

Fast forward to today and I am still in bed, it was 7am when I heard two men say my name out loud -- through the speakers of my phone. Me having just woken up this moment, I figured i misheard something. I pick up the phone, look at it and hear my name again. This time with a subtle laugh going on in the background. I was shocked, turned off the phone, factory reset just now with a couple of important passwords changed via my laptop.

I am not sure why I am posting here, I just needed to vent I guess. I feel horrible right now.
stories.title: Is privacy a thing of the past? My Android device let strangers talk to me

stories.text:
Hubble's deep field image changed our understanding of the number of galaxies in the universe.

Does the new Webb deep field up the estimate? Or are it's findings in line with what was expected?
stories.title: Ask HN: Does Webb change the estimate of number of galaxies in the universe?
Webb and the Big Bang – Webb/NASA
